title: How to recover deleted files from my mobile phone - Quora

response.answer_text: Photos is important to us, witnessing every memory we want to cherish in life. How to recover photos if we lose them?  1. Recover Deleted Photos from iPhone with iTunes  There’s a strong chance that the last backup that iTunes took of your iPhone has those special photos that you want back if you are using to syncing your iphone every once in a while. Step 1: Connect your iPhone to the computer Step 2: Open iTunes Step 3: Enable the sidebar through View -> Show Sidebar Step 4: Right-click on your device and press ‘Restore from backup… Step 5: Choose the latest backup and proceed. 2. Recover Deleted Photos from Photo Stream / iCloud  If you’ve got Photo Stream enabled in iCloud (on your iOS device: Settings -> iCloud -> Photos -> Switch ON ‘My Photo Stream’), may be the photos you are looking for are already there.  Step 1: Open the Photos app Step 2: From the menu on the bottom, tap on ‘Albums’ Step 3: Choose the ‘My Photo Stream’ album Step 4: Check to see if your photos are in this album. 3: Using a third-party software can be costly but that's the only option left in case everything else fails. Simple Steps to Recover Photos Easy Way to follow  Step 1: Recover from iPhones Directly Step 2: Recover from iTunes Backup Files Step 3: Recover from iCloud Backup Files Deleted photos are often deep within the file system and will be overwritten after sometime. In case you are looking for deleted photos soon after they were deleted, chances of finding them through the third-party software are high. 4. Lessons for Apple Users 1)Backup your iPhone in iTunes weekly once. If you click photos a lot, increase the backup frequency. 2)Make use of iCloud. Enable Photo Stream and make sure photos you click are on Photo Stream so you can recover in case you lose them from your Camera Roll. 5. Visit Us for More Details  Link Shortcut: http://goo.gl/Gjnl8z

Recovery of deleted files FonePaw Android Data Recovery, a cutting edge program, is designed to help Android users to recover deleted/lost data from Android phones which includes Samsung Galaxy, Google Nexus, LG, Sony, HTC, Motorola, Huawei, OnePlus, AUSU and ZTE. Only with several clicks, it is available torecover deleted photos, videos, music, text messages,WhatsApp, contacts, call logs and document files from Android phone. Step 1. Connect Android to PC To start with, install and run Android Data Recovery. Then connect Samsung device: Galaxy S7/S8 to PC with a USB cable that came with it.  Step 2. Allow for USB Debugging Turn on the Android device and touch for USB debugging. Then, the computer can access the connected portable device.For Android 2.3 or earlier:Enter"Settings"> "Applications">"Development" > "USB debugging". For Android 3.0 - 4.1:Go to"Settings" > "Developer options" >"USB debugging". For Android 4.2 or newer:Hit"Settings" > "About phone". Tab"Build number" for 7 times till the dialogue box "You are under developer mode" occurs. Then go back to "Settings" > "Developer options" > "USB Debugging".  Step 3. Choose File Types to Recover When Samsung is successfully matched now, you will be asked to select files types that you are intended to restore. Tick whichever ones you want and then the"Next"button. Android Data Recovery will scan and check all your options in the connected Samsung.  Step 4. Analyze Device and Get Privilege to Scan Files In this step, the program will check device information and then try to get root permission. When the window as below occurs, turn on the connected Samsung. Then go the Samsung and hit"Allow/Grant/ Authorize"to make sure the root request is accepted.  Once the program gets root permission, it will enable a data scan. Scanning can take some time. During this process, please wait patiently for phone file recovery.  Step 5. Preview and Recover Lost Files from Android Scanning is done! All the selected items are orderly sorted and listed at the left pane. Choose your wanted contents. They will be exhaustively shown in the table. If there is too much information, tap the"ON"icon and set to display the deleted items only. After that, choose all or some of them. And click"Recover", all that deleted fileswill be retrieved and saved on your computer.  Notes for Recovered Contents: The deleted files will be recovered to your computer. The following arethe recoverable contents of each file type and in what format they will be saved on your computer.

Refer to this site http://www.easyphonerecovery.com... I downloaded the software and followed all the instructions mentioned in this guide. To my pleasant surprise, I got my SMS’s, WhatsApp messages (without any video attachment), and MOST of the pictures (unfortunately, I couldn’t get all the pictures) and few videos back. First, I scanned my Android with the ’Standard Mode’ (without rooting my device) of the software and I saw some text messages, and 4-5 deleted pictures that I lost in the scanning results, but that wasn’t enough for me so I tried the ‘Advanced Mode’ as well. In the Advanced Mode, software had applied some soft root on my device. It was quick and easy. After scanning my device for about an hour, software showed me all the text messages, most of the pictures/photos (not all of them) and few videos that I lost during updating my device in the “Preview”. In the end, I clicked the “Recover” button and got all the data back. I didn’t try but as per the website, this software can also recover deleted data from the SD card. Remember, you can unroot your device later if you want. Here is good step-by-step tutorial to unroot an Android device: How to Unroot Your Android Phone Apart from the software I mentioned above, I also tried this Play Store app: https://play.google.com/store/ap... to get my lost data back. In order to use this app, you need to first root your device yourself as it needs root/SuperUser permission to scan your device. Unlike the above software, this software does not help you to root your device. It didn’t find any deleted pictures or text messages of my Android but it did show some videos and Whatsapp messages in the scan results. This is it! I hope someone who is looking to recover deleted Android data will find my answer.

Would you like to get back your permanently deleted data from your phone ?? don't worry about this, i have quite good experience for this situation which i wanna to share the solution of this problem. Recovering files via Recently deleted data and file is click on Photos library‘Recently deleted’ album.Select all pictures you wish to reinstate.Tap on ‘Restore’ button.You’ll now find the file at the location from where it was originally deleted.What to do if the file isn’t found in Recently deleted album? You may not be able to find your file laying in recently delete folder for 2 reasons- You might have permanently deleted from this folder, or,It might have been automatically removed by your device after 30 days.How to Find Photos and Videos from Offsite Backup? Sign in to your iCloud account on a PC or Mac .Click to Photos, here you can find your backup files like photo and videosFind your data and Select the photos you want to restore.Click on ‘download’ button in the menu bar.now you get the images from icloud to your pc, you can easily use.Hope here you will get the solution of your problem

The chances of recovering deleted files from any mobile phone completely depend on whether your deleted data has been overwritten or not. Keep in mind that if the files are overwritten, then it is like impossible to recover them, so in this case, you require to stop using your phone or keep it on Airplane mode, because more phone usage means more files will be overwritten. If not, good news for you, Yes, you can recover your deleted files from your phone. Like if you have an Android or iOS phone, make sure to get the right data recovery solution based on your phone. In simple words, all you need is the best data recovery software for Android or iPhone and get your files back within no time. If you are not familiar with any such software, going with dr.fone data recovery software for either Android or iPhone, could be your best decision.

step 1 :Stop Updating Your Android Once Lost Precious DataIf your Android data is lost, stop adding or deleting any data of your Android. If not, your Android data will be overwritten. That is, all your lost data cannot come back to you any more. So, make sure not to update your Android as long as your data get lost. Step 2 Run the Android Data Recovery Install the program on your computer and run it, you will be asked to connect your Android device to PC via USB. Step 3 Set up Android to enable USB debugging After connectting your Android to the computer, go to the step 2 - Enable USB debugging. Here you have three ways to do it according to different Android OS version:1. For Android 4.2 or the newer: Enter "Settings > About Phone > Build number" for several times and when you get the note: "You are under developer mode", you can go back to "Settings > Developer options> USB debugging".2. Android 3.0 to 4.1: Enter "Settings > Developer option > USB debugging".3. Android 2.3 or earlier: Enter "Settings > Applications > Development > USB debugging".

If you lost photos from your iPhone 6, iPhone 6 Plus or any other iPhone running in iOS 8, the Photos app now features a Trash can (Recycle Bin) where your deleted photos reside. If you accidentally delete a photo and want to recover it, please follow the instruction below. Open your Photos app.Tap on the Albums menu to open the list of albums.Tap on Recently Deleted.You see a list of photos. Tap on the photo you want to recover.When the photo opens, you can tap on Recover (bottom-right.)The photo will be restored to the original album it was in. Most of the time, you’re going to see that photo inRecently Added.

First thing to note is that the deleted data on the phone will remain there until something new is saved and overwrites it. This might not happen immediately but eventually, after continued use, it will.  Either connect the phone straight to a PC using a USB cable (if supplied with the phone) or take the card out and put it in a card reader attached to the PC. You should see memory card shown as a drive letter (like H:) in Windows Explorer.  Then try some photo data software on the PC.

As a matter of fact, when you delete the files from your phone, even your computer or other storage devices, the deleted files are not actually gone permanently-they are still saved in the device which they were stored before. One thing different is those files space is marked as available for other new files to write over or occupy. So it is possible to recover lost files if you act quickly before the files are overwritten by the new one.How Do You Retrieve Deleted Photos & Pictures on iPod touch
